Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster(n)

programme.title: Play Misty for Me
programme.desc: A DJ has a one-night stand with an obsessive woman who repeatedly calls his station with the same song request. When he revives his relationship with an old flame, his unstable fan is driven mad with jealousy. Psychological thriller, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, with Jessica Walter, Donna Mills, John Larch and James McEachin(n)

programme.title: Close Range
programme.desc: Action thriller, starring Scott Adkins as a former soldier forced to protect his family from corrupt cops and drug cartel thugs. With Caitlin Keats, Nick Chinlund and Tony Perez(n)

programme.title: Kite
programme.desc: A teenager living in a corrupt society dominated by violent street gangs swears revenge when her parents are murdered. Joining forces with her father's former partner on the police force, she journeys into the depths of the criminal underworld to learn the killers' identities. Crime thriller, starring India Eisley and Samuel L Jackson(n)

programme.title: Spooks: The Greater Good
programme.desc: A terrorist escapes custody during a prisoner handover when the convoy he is being transported in is attacked, leading to a CIA operative being killed and relations becoming frayed between British and American intelligence agencies. MI5 officer Will Holloway must team up with disgraced intelligence chief Harry Pearce to track him down before an imminent terrorist attack on London. Spy thriller, starring Kit Harington and Peter Firth(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette(n)

programme.title: Regression
programme.desc: In 1990, Minnesota detective Bruce Kenner finds evidence of a satanic cult when he investigates the case of John Gray, who admits to sexually abusing his 17-year-old daughter Angela, but has no recollection of it. Psychological thriller, starring Ethan Hawke, Emma Watson and David Thewlis(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
programme.desc: An American teenager is sent to live with his father in Tokyo after a brush with the law, but soon becomes involved in illegal street racing. When he ends up owing money to gangsters after losing a race against a driver with Yakuza connections, he has to learn to master the Japanese style of driving to win and pay back his debts. Action adventure, starring Lucas Black, Nathalie Kelley and Bow Wow(n)

programme.title: Spooks: The Greater Good
programme.desc: A terrorist escapes custody during a prisoner handover when the convoy he is being transported in is attacked, leading to a CIA operative being killed and relations becoming frayed between British and American intelligence agencies. MI5 officer Will Holloway must team up with disgraced intelligence chief Harry Pearce to track him down before an imminent terrorist attack on London. Spy thriller, starring Kit Harington and Peter Firth(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Footsoldier II
programme.desc: Haunted by the loss of his best friends in the Essex Range Rover murders, gangster Carlton Leach considers leaving his violent lifestyle behind him. Crime thriller, starring Ricci Harnett, Luke Mably and Steven Berkoff(n)

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. To break their stranglehold on the city, the FBI sends in a chemical weapons expert and a jailed SAS veteran, chosen because he is the only man to have ever escaped from the infamous penitentiary. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris(n)

programme.title: Zulu
programme.desc: Two South African police officers, one black and one white, investigate the murder of a teenage girl. The case brings to light the lingering consequences of apartheid, and forces both men to face up to their own roles in their country's brutal history. Crime drama based on Caryl Ferey's novel, with Forest Whitaker and Orlando Bloom(n)

programme.title: Loss of Faith
programme.desc: A crime writer is drawn into intrigue and danger while investigating the kidnapping of a baby boy and the murder of the child's wealthy father. Mystery thriller, starring John Ritter, Michele Scarabelli, Daphne Zuniga and Roddy McDowall(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: A family of police officers is thrown into turmoil when semi-retired brother Ray is charged with investigating the deaths of four officers during an ambush at a drug dealer's apartment. When his findings reveal evidence of departmental corruption, Ray finds himself divided between personal loyalties and duty to his badge. Thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Edward Norton, Jon Voight and Noah Emmerich(n)

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: An imprisoned art thief and forger learns that his son is dying, and applies for early release. While his request is granted, he learns that the shady characters who granted his freedom want him to assist them in a daring heist, leaving him torn between carrying out the robbery and making his son's last wishes come true. Crime thriller, starring John Travolta and Christopher Plummer(n)

programme.title: The Prestige
programme.desc: Victorian stage illusionists Robert Angier and Alfred Borden engage in a bitter personal and professional rivalry. The pair resort to increasingly brutal measures to sabotage each other's acts, while Angier becomes obsessed with the secret behind Borden's greatest illusion. Christopher Nolan's mystery thriller, starring Hugh Jackman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Piper Perabo and Scarlett Johansson, with David Bowie as real-life scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla(n)

programme.title: Mercury Rising
programme.desc: A top-secret government agency has developed a seemingly unbreakable code - only for an autistic boy to crack it in an instant. Assassins succeed in gunning down his parents, but a maverick FBI agent investigating their deaths finds the child hiding in a closet, and resolves to shield him from the hitmen on his trail. Thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alec Baldwin and Miko Hughes(n)

programme.title: McCanick
programme.desc: A narcotics cop learns a small-time crook has been released from prison and goes behind the chief of police's back to organise a disproportionate manhunt for him. As his methods grow increasingly brutal, he comes closer to learning a secret from his own past. Detective drama, starring David Morse and Cory Monteith, in his final film role(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster(n)

programme.title: The Colony
programme.desc: A man travelling through Chile in the 1970s is abducted by the secret police during the military coup that brought Pinochet to power. His girlfriend tries to find out what has happened to him, but to uncover the truth, she must join a cult posing as a charitable organisation, from which no one has ever escaped. Drama, starring Emma Watson and Daniel Bruhl(n)

programme.title: Taken
programme.desc: An American teenager travelling through Europe is abducted by a gang of sex traffickers. However, what the kidnappers do not realise is that the girl's father is a former CIA agent, who employs all his old skills as he searches for the criminals and tries to rescue his daughter. Thriller, starring Liam Neeson, Famke Janssen and Maggie Grace(n)

programme.title: The Prestige
programme.desc: Victorian stage illusionists Robert Angier and Alfred Borden engage in a bitter personal and professional rivalry. The pair resort to increasingly brutal measures to sabotage each other's acts, while Angier becomes obsessed with the secret behind Borden's greatest illusion. Christopher Nolan's mystery thriller, starring Hugh Jackman, Christian Bale, Michael Caine, Piper Perabo and Scarlett Johansson, with David Bowie as real-life scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla(n)

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A seven-year-old girl witnesses the murder of her mother and sisters, and testifies that her teenage brother was the killer, leading to his imprisonment. As an adult, she attends a gathering of true-crime fans, and discovers they all think her brother was innocent. She reluctantly agrees to revisit the crime, and begins to realise her memories may not be as reliable as she thought. Mystery, starring Charlize Theron, Nicholas Hoult, Christina Hendricks and Chloe Grace Moretz(n)

programme.title: Go
programme.desc: Two supermarket checkout girls covering for their friends on Christmas Eve get drawn into a drugs sting and are forced to cross a dealer to save themselves. Their absent colleagues endure a disastrous night's gambling in Las Vegas, while two men forced to take part in the sting find themselves spending a festive night with a narcotics agent. Drama, starring Katie Holmes, William Fichtner and JE Freeman(n)

programme.title: Angel Flight Down
programme.desc: A mercy mission runs into difficulty when the plane commissioned to airlift a sick girl suffers engine trouble and crashes on the edge of a cliff. Drama, starring Patricia Kalember and David Charvet(n)

programme.title: Snake Eyes
programme.desc: A corrupt cop seals off all exits in a casino after the fatal shooting of a US Defence Department official - but while frantically searching for the assassin among the 14,000-strong crowd, he is daunted by the sheer scale of the challenge. Thriller from director Brian De Palma, starring Nicolas Cage, Gary Sinise, John Heard and Carla Gugino(n)

programme.title: Go With Me
programme.desc: A woman returns to the isolated logging community where she grew up, and is stalked by a former cop, who now heads up a criminal organisation in the area that operates above the law. She resolves to take a stand against him, seeking the aid of a retired logger and his sidekick. Thriller based on Castle Freeman Jr's novel, starring Julia Stiles, Anthony Hopkins, Alexander Ludwig and Ray Liotta(n)

programme.title: US Marshals
programme.desc: A federal marshal sets out in pursuit of an escaped prisoner who is determined to prove his murder conviction was false. As the chase progresses, the marshal is forced to work with a diplomatic security agent, making him realise the fugitive is no ordinary convict and that his claims of innocence may be true. Thriller sequel, starring Tommy Lee Jones reprising his Oscar-winning role from The Fugitive, alongside Wesley Snipes and Robert Downey Jr(n)

programme.title: The Man from UNCLE
programme.desc: A CIA agent is forced into an uneasy alliance with his arch-rival in the KGB at the height of the Cold War. A criminal organisation is planning to alter the balance of power by making nuclear weapons widely available, and the two spies must work together to foil the plan. Action adventure based on the 1960s TV series, starring Henry Cavill, Armie Hammer, Alicia Vikander and Hugh Grant(n)

programme.title: Exposed
programme.desc: A detective is determined to bring his dead partner's killers to justice, despite warnings from both his superior officers and the murdered man's wife to forget about it. As he delves deeper, he uncovers dangerous secrets and evidence of political corruption, with a devoutly religious woman seemingly the key to the mystery. Crime thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Ana de Armas and Mira Sorvino(n)

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: In a move to identify suspected hijackers, an undercover police officer infiltrates the high-octane world of illegal late-night street racing by rival gangs. He is befriended by a champion driver, but when he also forms a bond with the racer's sister, he is pitched into a conflict of loyalties. Thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster(n)

programme.title: US Marshals
programme.desc: A federal marshal sets out in pursuit of an escaped prisoner who is determined to prove his murder conviction was false. As the chase progresses, the marshal is forced to work with a diplomatic security agent, making him realise the fugitive is no ordinary convict and that his claims of innocence may be true. Thriller sequel, starring Tommy Lee Jones reprising his Oscar-winning role from The Fugitive, alongside Wesley Snipes and Robert Downey Jr(n)

programme.title: The Man from UNCLE
programme.desc: A CIA agent is forced into an uneasy alliance with his arch-rival in the KGB at the height of the Cold War. A criminal organisation is planning to alter the balance of power by making nuclear weapons widely available, and the two spies must work together to foil the plan. Action adventure based on the 1960s TV series, starring Henry Cavill, Armie Hammer, Alicia Vikander and Hugh Grant(n)

programme.title: We Still Kill the Old Way
programme.desc: A former gangster returns to London after 30 years living in exile in Spain when he receives word of his brother's murder. Angered by the brutality of a new generation of criminals who have taken over his territory, he gets his old partners in crime back together to avenge his sibling and restore order to the streets. Gangster drama, starring Ian Ogilvy and Allison Doody(n)

programme.title: Batman & Robin
programme.desc: The caped crusader and his sidekick take on the villainous Mr Freeze, who plans to destroy Gotham City with an icy doomsday weapon unless his demands are met. The dynamic duo also have to contend with femme fatale Poison Ivy, who is determined to drive a wedge between them. Comic-book adventure, starring George Clooney, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Uma Thurman and Chris O'Donnell(n)

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi(n)

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Conflict erupts between the defenders of a kingdom and an invading horde that has travelled from a dying world. Fantasy adventure based on the best-selling computer game, starring Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton and Ben Foster(n)

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell: Special
programme.desc: A look at the live-action remake of the iconic sci-fi animation, starring Scarlett Johansson, Takeshi Kitano and Michael Pitt(n)

programme.title: Friend Request
programme.desc: A teenager meets a girl online, only to find she is a demonic entity intent on killing her real friends. Horror, starring Alycia Debnam-Carey and William Moseley(n)

programme.title: Darling
programme.desc: A woman takes a job housesitting a mansion that has a grisly history. Alone in the building, she begins to suffer a series of terrifying visions and is left unable to tell whether she is descending into madness or if there really is a supernatural force at work. Horror, starring Lauren Ashley Carter and Sean Young(n)

programme.title: The Returned
programme.desc: A young doctor goes on the run with her bitten boyfriend and their remaining supplies of a protein used to treat a zombie virus. Sci-fi horror, starring Emily Hampshire, Kris Holden-Ried and Shawn Doyle(n)

programme.title: The NeverEnding Story
programme.desc: A lonely boy, neglected by his father and bullied at school, finds comfort in a mysterious book about a young hero's quest to save his world from destruction. However, as he reads the tale, he begins to become part of the story. Fantasy adventure based on Michael Edne's novel, starring Barret Oliver, Noah Hathaway, Gerald McRaney, Moses Gunn and Patricia Hayes(n)

programme.title: Minority Report
programme.desc: Cop John Anderton is forced to go on the run when a supposedly infallible trio of psychics foretell he is about to kill a man he has never heard of. Convinced their prediction is false, he kidnaps one of the so-called precogs to prove his innocence - and stumbles across a complex conspiracy. Steven Spielberg's futuristic thriller, starring Tom Cruise, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton and Max von Sydow(n)

programme.title: Ghost in the Shell: Special
programme.desc: A look at the live-action remake of the iconic sci-fi animation, starring Scarlett Johansson, Takeshi Kitano and Michael Pitt(n)

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: An alien arrives on Earth, accompanied by an awesomely powerful robot, on a fateful mission - to decide if the human race deserves to continue - and if not, to wipe it out. The visitor is imprisoned in a military facility, but a scientist helps him escape, hoping to prove that mankind is worth saving. Sci-fi drama remake, starring Keanu Reeves and Jennifer Connelly(n)

programme.title: Cell
programme.desc: A mysterious signal is transmitted to every mobile phone in the world, causing those who hear it to turn into bloodthirsty maniacs. A writer who was unaffected by the transmission bands together with a few other survivors to track down his family and unlock the mystery behind the crisis. Sci-fi thriller based on Stephen King's novel, starring John Cusack and Samuel L Jackson(n)

programme.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out Of The Shadows
programme.desc: The sewer-dwelling heroes battle more bad guys when Shredder breaks out of custody and teams up with the villainous Krang. Action comedy sequel, starring Megan Fox, Will Arnett and Laura Linney(n)

programme.title: Minority Report

programme.desc: The sewer-dwelling heroes battle more bad guys when Shredder breaks out of custody and teams up with the villainous Krang. Action comedy sequel, starring Megan Fox, Will Arnett and Laura Linney(n)

programme.title: Alien Nation
programme.desc: A race of aliens fleeing slavery seeks shelter on Earth. One of their number becomes a cop, and is paired with a bigoted human partner to investigate a murder. However, they soon find the case leads to a secret that has devastating repercussions for the extraterrestrial community. Sci-fi adventure, starring James Caan, Mandy Patinkin and Terence Stamp(n)

programme.title: Hacked
programme.desc: A student watches a video of a murder on the internet, but the police refuse to believe the events in the film are real. She sets out to prove someone really has been killed, only to find herself trapped in a deadly game and in danger of becoming the murderer's next target. Thriller, starring Melanie Papalia and David Schlachtenhaufen(n)

programme.title: The Lesson
programme.desc: A teacher is driven to the brink of despair on the last day of term by his abusive and apathetic students. He finally snaps, and later that night, resorts to kidnapping one of the worst troublemakers in his class and trying to force him to learn - at gunpoint if need be. Thriller, starring Robert Hands and Evan Bendall(n)

programme.title: Cocoon: The Return
programme.desc: Three elderly couples return to Earth five years after leaving to retire on a distant planet, surprising their families, who assumed they were dead. Several of their alien friends have come back with them to recover members of their own race left behind in cocoons on the ocean floor, one of whom has been abducted by a government research institute. Sci-fi sequel, with Wilford Brimley, Don Ameche, Steve Guttenberg and Jessica Tandy(n)

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel meets his match in the form of three fugitive villains from his home planet of Krypton. Flying down to Earth, the super-powered trio unleash a reign of terror in a bid to take over the world - but Superman is not there to stop them, having surrendered his powers to lead a normal life with his beloved Lois Lane. Comic-strip adventure sequel, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Terence Stamp and Margot Kidder(n)

programme.title: Superman III
programme.desc: The Man of Steel battles an evil tycoon, who has recruited a computer genius to aid his schemes for world domination. Together the villains hatch a plan to dispose of Superman once and for all - but instead of killing the superhero, they accidentally unveil his dark side. Comic-book adventure sequel, starring Christopher Reeve, Richard Pryor, Robert Vaughn and Margot Kidder(n)

programme.title: Into the Forest
programme.desc: An unexplained cataclysm devastates the world, rendering virtually all technology useless. Two teenage sisters living in the backwoods face a series of challenges as they struggle to survive in a world changed beyond all recognition. Sci-fi drama based on Jean Hegland's novel, starring Ellen Page and Evan Rachel Wood(n)

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War
programme.desc: The Avengers are divided over a system of government control for their actions, leading to war between them. However, before Iron Man's side clashes with Captain America's, Tony Stark recruits extra help in the form of a brilliant young crime fighter called Spider-Man. Superhero adventure, starring Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr and Scarlett Johansson(n)

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: A grieving mother living in India learns of a temple that contains a mysterious portal, through which she would be able to speak to her dead son one last time. She disobeys instructions not to open the portal fully, and disrupts the balance between life and death as the boy's dangerous spirit is unleashed into the world - and worse besides. Horror, starring Sarah Wayne Callies and Jeremy Sisto(n)

programme.title: Anguish
programme.desc: A teenage girl has struggled with mental health issues all her life, experiencing anxiety attacks and hallucinations. She discovers that her condition may be the result of a spirit possessing her - a revelation that leaves her forced to choose whether to allow the entity to take her over utterly or to fight to keep it under control. Horror, starring Ryan Simpkins and Annika Marks(n)

Horror, starring Ryan Simpkins and Annika Marks(n)

programme.title: Exit
programme.desc: A lonely middle-aged woman becomes drawn to a man she meets while caring for her hospitalised mother-in-law. Taiwanese drama, starring Shiang-chyi Chen, Ming-hsiang Tung and Ming-Hua Pai(n)

programme.title: Gentlemen
programme.desc: A terrified young writer hides in a Stockholm apartment, where he writes the story of its missing inhabitants, the flamboyant, charismatic Morgan brothers. Swedish thriller, starrring David Dencik, Sverrir Gudnason and David Fukamachi Regnfors(n)

programme.title: Bluebird
programme.desc: During a freezing cold winter in the frozen woods of an isolated Maine logging town, a lapse of concentration has devastating consequences for a school bus driver. Drama, starring Amy Morton, John Slattery and Louisa Krause(n)

programme.title: A Tale of Love and Darkness
programme.desc: Historical drama based on the memoir of acclaimed writer Amos Oz, exploring the founding of the state of Israel and a young writer's relationship with his mother. Written, directed by and starring Natalie Portman, with Shira Haas(n)

programme.title: Up for Love
programme.desc: A diminutive architect woos a beautiful lawyer over the phone, but it remains to be seen whether his stature will prove a stumbling block. French romantic comedy, starring Jean Dujardin, Virginie Efira and Cedric Kahn(n)

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: A war veteran criss-crosses America with his disabled brother in tow as he builds a new career as a renowned prizefighter. However, his ruthless determination to make it to the top drives him to betray the people closest to him. Drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Marilyn Maxwell, Arthur Kennedy, Paul Stewart and Ruth Roman(n)

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer(n)

programme.title: One Hour Photo
programme.desc: A lonely photo technician develops an increasing obsession with a seemingly perfect couple and their child, whose pictures he processes - but when he uncovers evidence of marital infidelity, he resolves to expose the truth, regardless of the cost. Psychological thriller, starring Robin Williams, Connie Nielsen, Michael Vartan, Gary Cole and Dylan Smith(n)

programme.title: The Darjeeling Limited
programme.desc: Three brothers drift apart after their father's death. A year later, the eldest arranges for the other two to join him on a soul-searching trip across India to rebuild their relationship and track down their estranged mother. Wes Anderson's comedy drama, starring Owen Wilson, Adrien Brody, Jason Schwartzman and Anjelica Huston(n)

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: A teacher develops an irrational dislike for an overambitious student and plans to sabotage her campaign for school president. He persuades a dim-witted athlete to stand, in the hope he will pip the high-achieving front-runner to the post - but the intervention of another student throws the plan into disarray. Satirical comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Reese Witherspoon, Chris Klein and Jessica Campbell(n)

programme.title: Game On
programme.desc: A young street artist's plan to move to London is put on hold when her mother and grandmother face eviction. Musical, starring Kinga Preis, Eliza Rycembel, Stanislawa Celinska and Sebastian Fabijanski(n)

programme.title: New Jack City
programme.desc: Two maverick cops set out to topple a drugs baron who has transformed an apartment block into a seemingly impregnable fortress, but reckon without the villain's determination to stay out of jail - leading to explosive confrontations. Action thriller, starring Wesley Snipes, Ice-T, Judd Nelson, Chris Rock and Allen Payne(n)

programme.title: Down Dog
programme.desc: A sex-obsessed Lothario neglects his awkward teenage son, until he is tricked into believing he only has a year to live. Comedy, starring Jason Durr, Nick Moran and Orla O'Rourke(n)

programme.title: Long Way North
programme.desc: A Russian aristocrat travels to the North Pole in search of her grandfather, a missing explorer. Animated adventure, with the voices of Chloe Dunn, Geoffrey Greenhill and Tom Morton(n)

programme.title: The Hour of the Lynx
programme.desc: A disturbed young man committed to a psychiatric ward after murdering a couple tries to kill himself while ranting about God. A scientist aiding his treatment seeks the help of a priest in uncovering the roots of his psychosis, a process complicated by the clash of their personal ideologies. Drama, starring Sofie Grabol and Soren Malling. In Danish and Swedish(n)

programme.title: Dead Calm
programme.desc: A husband and wife take a yachting trip to help recover from the death of their son. While out on the open water the couple spot a sinking ship and manage to save the only person left on board - but they come to bitterly regret their good deed when the situation turns dark and a fraught battle of wits ensues. Thriller, based on a novel by Charles Williams, with Sam Neill, Nicole Kidman and Billy Zane(n)

programme.title: Men & Chicken
programme.desc: Two brothers discover they are adopted, and go in search of their biological father, a reclusive scientist. The search leads them to their three eccentric half-brothers, who live together on an island, and a shocking revelation about their father's research. Comedy, starring David Dencik and Mads Mikkelsen. In Danish(n)

A bureaucrat in a totalitarian society whose populace are kept under constant surveillance begins to question the regime he works for, and begins a secret, illegal relationship with a fellow subversive. However, their small rebellion is doomed to end in tragedy. Futuristic drama based on George Orwell's novel, starring John Hurt Richard Burton and Suzanna Hamilton(n)

programme.title: Dirty Harry
programme.desc: Maverick San Francisco detective `Dirty' Harry Callahan sets out to capture a deranged sniper picking off victims at random. Although his own tactics barely stay within the confines of the law, he is determined the killer will face his particular brand of justice, regardless of his superiors' disapproval. Don Siegel's thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, Harry Guardino and Andy Robinson(n)

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: A pimp and drug pusher decides to change his ways after reaching the age at which his father died. Using his experience of life on the streets, he becomes a rapper, and an encounter with a local hip-hop star gives him the perfect chance to begin his career in music. Drama, starring Terrence Howard, Anthony Anderson, Taryn Manning and Isaac Hayes(n)

programme.title: The Commune
programme.desc: A couple establish a commune in a large house in 1970s Copenhagen, encouraging anyone who wants to escape the outside world to join them and their daughter. A succession of unusual characters pass through the collective, but their supposed utopia looks set to be torn apart by an affair within the group. Drama, starring Ulrich Thomsen and Fares Fares. In Danish(n)

programme.title: Gattaca
programme.desc: In a future run by a genetically enhanced elite, a caretaker who was born unmodified is barred from all but the most menial jobs. He swaps identities with a former athlete who has lost the use of his legs in an accident, allowing him to realise his dream of joining the space programme. However, a murder investigation threatens to expose his deception. Sci-fi drama, starring Ethan Hawke, Uma Thurman and Jude Law(n)

programme.title: Psycho
programme.desc: A woman on the run after stealing from her boss ends up at an isolated motel, where the owner's curious relationship with his domineering mother results in murder. Alfred Hitchcock's psychological thriller, starring Anthony Perkins, Janet Leigh, Vera Miles, Martin Balsam, John Gavin and John McIntire(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: A cop infiltrates the inner circle of a feared Boston mobster, unaware a fellow officer is already an informant on the gangster's payroll. When both the crooks and the police discover they have a mole in their ranks, the two detectives realise they are in sudden danger and try to expose each other. Martin Scorsese's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg, Martin Sheen and Alec Baldwin(n)

programme.title: Partisan
programme.desc: A young boy raised to be an assassin starts to question the ways of his community's charismatic and domineering leader. Drama, with Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel and Florence Mezzara(n)

programme.title: Rebel Without a Cause
programme.desc: An angry teenage social outcast rejects any form of authority in his search for a sense of identity. Eventually, he finds solace in the company of two like-minded and equally alienated misfits. However, a spate of violent confrontations forces them to go on the run, and their plan to stay in hiding has tragic consequences. Drama, starring James Dean, Natalie Wood, Sal Mineo and Jim Backus(n)

programme.title: Northwest
programme.desc: A teenage burglar uses his ill-gotten gains to support his mother and younger brother. Longing for a more profitable line of work, he gets involved with a gangster, but soon he and his sibling are in over their heads as they are drawn into a world of drugs and prostitution. Crime drama, starring real-life brothers Gustav and Oscar Dyekjaer Giese. In Danish(n)

programme.title: Grandma
programme.desc: A woman recovering from a break-up receives an unexpected visit from her granddaughter, who desperately needs to raise $600 before the end of the day. They visit a series of old contacts in search of a loan, which leads to long-buried secrets coming to light. Comedy drama, starring Lily Tomlin and Julia Garner(n)

programme.title: Inception
programme.desc: A talented thief uses hi-tech devices to enter other people's dreams so he can steal their secrets. An industrialist hires him to perform a far more challenging job - to implant an idea into a corporate heir's mind, so he will think it is his own. However, the mission is compromised by the thief's own troubled psyche. Christopher Nolan's sci-fi thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Ellen Page, Joseph Gordon-Levitt and Tom Hardy(n)

programme.title: Still the Water
programme.desc: Two teenagers fall in love while he is coming to terms with the divorce of his parents and she is coping with the imminent death of her mother. Coming-of-age drama, starring Nijiro Murakami, Jun Yoshinaga and Miyuki Matsuda(n)

programme.title: Escape from Alcatraz
programme.desc: A cunning convict with a history of making escape attempts is transferred to the notorious high-security island prison off the California coast, from which no one has ever broken out. Continually at odds with the brutal warden, he and three fellow prisoners hatch a plan to make it to freedom on an improvised raft. Thriller, based on a true story, starring Clint Eastwood, Patrick McGoohan, Roberts Blossom and Fred Ward(n)

programme.title: The Surprise
programme.desc: After signing an agreement with a company specialising in assisted suicides, a deeply depressed man suddenly falls in love. Romantic comedy, starring Jeroen van Koningsbrugge, Georgina Verbaan and Jan Decleir(n)

programme.title: Girl, Interrupted
programme.desc: A would-be writer in the 1960s is committed to an exclusive psychiatric ward by her parents after attempting suicide, but the move seems to cause more problems than it solves. Fact-based drama, starring Winona Ryder and an Oscar-winning Angelina Jolie alongside Clea Duvall, Brittany Murphy, Whoopi Goldberg and Vanessa Redgrave(n)

programme.title: Maggie's Plan
programme.desc: A young New Yorker's plan to have a kid on her own is derailed when she falls for a married man. Romantic comedy, starring Greta Gerwig, Ethan Hawke and Bill Hader(n)

programme.title: The Usual Suspects
programme.desc: Five criminals are brought together by a police line-up, and decide to join forces to pull off one more big job. However, they discover their meeting was not a coincidence and that a mysterious crime lord has plans for them. Bryan Singer's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Gabriel Byrne, Kevin Spacey, Benicio Del Toro, Kevin Pollak, Stephen Baldwin, Pete Postlethwaite, Chazz Palminteri and Suzy Amis(n)

programme.title: The Goob
programme.desc: A teenager spends every summer helping out in his mother's cafe and working on the harvest in the nearby pumpkin fields. The latest harvest season proves a very different one, as tension brews with his mother's new boyfriend and a flirtatious relationship with a foreign worker in the fields makes him consider a different future. Drama, starring Liam Walpole and Marama Corlett(n)

programme.title: The Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Three men gather at the funeral of a Spanish actress and countess who rose from peasant origins to become a Hollywood star. A movie director recalls how he made her famous, a PR agent remembers her doomed romance with a millionaire, and her aristocratic husband contemplates the events that destroyed their marriage. Satirical drama in flashback format, with Ava Gardner, Humphrey Bogart, Edmond O'Brien, Rossano Brazzi and Marius Goring(n)

programme.title: Anzio
programme.desc: An American war correspondent joins Allied troops in 1944 as they prepare for their landing in Italy. A strategic blunder by their commanding officer gives German forces time to reinforce the area, leaving the reporter caught up in one of the campaign's fiercest battles. Second World War drama, starring Robert Mitchum, Peter Falk, Arthur Kennedy, Robert Ryan and Earl Holliman(n)

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her father's killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderer's trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper(n)

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe(n)

programme.title: The Other Woman
programme.desc: A woman is devastated to learn her boyfriend is actually married, but when she meets his wife, they quickly become friends. When they discover he has a third secret lover, they decide to join forces and teach him a lesson. Comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Leslie Mann, Kate Upton and Nikolaj Coster-Waldau(n)

programme.title: Unfaithful
programme.desc: A New York woman with a seemingly perfect marriage has an accidental encounter with a charming Frenchman. Their physical attraction is immediate, and although she realises she is risking everything, she cannot help herself from being drawn into a passionate affair. In time her husband grows suspicious, and eventually confronts her lover with a level of anger he never imagined himself capable of. Thriller, with Diane Lane, Olivier Martinez and Richard Gere(n)

programme.title: The Joneses
programme.desc: A seemingly perfect family moves into a community and instantly arouses the envy of their neighbours. What the townsfolk do not realise is the newcomers have been placed there for precisely that purpose - they are a living exercise in product placement, designed to drive those around them into a frenzy of jealous consumption. Satirical comedy, with David Duchovny and Demi Moore(n)

programme.title: Down to the Sea in Ships
programme.desc: Sea captain Bering Joy takes his grandson Jed on a whaling trip to teach him about life's challenges and truths, while first mate Dan Lunceford's assignment to look after the lad has dramatic consequences on a voyage packed with incident and danger. Seafaring adventure, starring Lionel Barrymore, Richard Widmark, and Dean Stockwell(n)

programme.title: Face of a Fugitive
programme.desc: A man wrongly accused of murder flees from the authorities to start a new life in a Mexican border town. He ends up helping the local sheriff deal with a corrupt rancher's crooked schemes, while falling for the lawman's sister. However, his new-found happiness is threatened when his face starts to appear on wanted posters. Western, starring Fred MacMurray, Lin McCarthy, Alan Baxter and James Coburn(n)

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush(n)

programme.title: Comanche
programme.desc: A powerful Native American chief agrees to take part in peace talks with Washington after an encounter with a sympathetic scout. However, a group of renegade warriors are unwilling to surrender their arms and their actions prompt a bigoted government official to use brutal methods. Western, starring Dana Andrews, Kent Smith, Nestor Paiva and Henry Brandon(n)

programme.title: Admission
programme.desc: A by-the-book university admissions officer visits an unconventional school run by a former college friend to interview a gifted student. She begins to suspect the pupil may be the son she gave up for adoption, and the experience makes her rethink her uncompromising outlook on life. Comedy drama, with Tina Fey and Paul Rudd(n)

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: A paraplegic soldier uses technology that allows him to control a genetically engineered body on a mission to a dangerous jungle world. His assignment is to infiltrate an alien tribe on behalf of a corrupt mining corporation, which wants to drive them from their land. He comes to sympathise with the natives, and helps them fight back against his employers. James Cameron's sci-fi adventure, starring Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver and Stephen Lang(n)

programme.title: Andrei Rublev
programme.desc: Andrei Tarkovsky's acclaimed historical drama chronicling the life of the 15th-century monk, icon painter and political activist, who leaves his monastery to travel to Moscow and witnesses an incident that causes him to take a vow of silence and renounce painting for more than a decade. Starring Anatoliy Solonitsyn and Ivan Lapikov. In Russian(n)

programme.title: Man in the Saddle
programme.desc: A wealthy and ambitious cattleman plans to seize all the land surrounding his own. A peaceful rancher living nearby ignores warnings to sell up and avoid a conflict, and as he suffers a campaign of intimidation, he is forced to adopt violent methods to defend his livelihood. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Alexander Knox, Joan Leslie and Ellen Drew(n)

programme.title: Bitter Victory
programme.desc: Two British officers are assigned to lead a raid on a German stronghold in Libya and steal secret documents. However, one of the pair suspects the other of having had an affair with his wife and the tension between them threatens the mission. Second World War drama, starring Richard Burton, Curt Jurgens, Ruth Roman and Christopher Lee(n)

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles(n)

programme.title: My Darling Clementine
programme.desc: Retired lawman Wyatt Earp accepts the post of Tombstone city marshal when one of his brothers is killed by cattle rustlers, and embarks on a crusade to bring his murderers to justice and drive lawlessness from the streets. Western, directed by John Ford, starring Henry Fonda, Victor Mature, Linda Darnell and Walter Brennan(n)

programme.title: Congo
programme.desc: An expedition to find King Solomon's diamond mines in the jungles of the Congo disappears without trace. The tycoon behind the mission sends his assistant, a former CIA agent, to find out what became of the explorers - only to discover that the party met a grisly fate at the hands of a horde of vicious apes. Action adventure based on Michael Crichton's novel, with Dylan Walsh, Laura Linney, Tim Curry and Grant Heslov(n)

programme.title: Ride Along
programme.desc: A wannabe police officer persuades his girlfriend's tough detective brother to take him along on duty. The cop hopes to scare his unwanted partner away from his sister by exposing him to danger - but needs some help when the patrol leads to a run-in with the city's most wanted criminal. Comedy, starring Ice Cube, Kevin Hart and Laurence Fishburne(n)

programme.title: Chicken
programme.desc: Premiere. Fifteen-year-old Richard has learning difficulties and lives a lonely, introverted life with his older brother Polly in a dilapidated caravan on a farm where they are squatting. When new owners take possession of the land, their presence brings excitement and hope for Richard, as he starts to develop a relationship with their 17-year-old daughter Annabel, but the new dynamic also provokes far darker consequences. Coming-of-age drama, starring Scott Chambers, Morgan Watkins and Yasmin Paige(n)

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Part two of two. Drama based on Louisa May Alcott's novel about four sisters growing up together in New England during the American Civil War. Starring Meredith Baxter, Susan Dey and Eve Plumb(n)

programme.title: Love Finds a Home
programme.desc: A female doctor in a small 19th-century town looks after a friend in the last stages of pregnancy, but finds herself continually at odds with her patient's mother-in-law, who believes in homeopathic treatments. The doctor also has to contend with her daughter's first love and her own inability to conceive. Period drama sequel, based on Janette Oke's novel, starring Sarah Jones and Haylie Duff(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Voice of the Heart
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of two unique and brilliant women, and the charismatic men they loved and lost, and to whom they ransomed their hearts. Lindsay Wagner, Victoria Tennant and James Brolin star(n)

programme.title: What Kind of Mother Are You
programme.desc: A woman finds it impossible to cope with her rebellious teenage daughter, so decides to scare her into changing her ways by leaving her to spend a night in jail. The plan goes tragically wrong when she discovers getting her child released is far from straightforward. Fact-based drama, starring Mel Harris, Nicholle Tom, Amanda Tapping and Alex Carter(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandpa gives the family cause for concern when he suffers a heart attack(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: To Live with Fear - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary is diagnosed with a lethal disease, leaving Charles struggling to raise the cash to pay for medical treatment(n)

programme.title: Remember
programme.desc: Part one of two. TV journalist Nicky Wells' life is shattered when her English aristocrat fiancee Charles Devereaux suddenly disappears. She tries to console herself by concentrating on her work, but a romantic encounter with war photographer Cleeland Donovan forces her to revisit the circumstances of her former lover's mysterious double life. Romantic drama, based on Barbara Taylor Bradford's novel, starring Donna Mills and Stephen Collins(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Secrets
programme.desc: The cast of a glossy American TV series' steamy on-screen relationships pale in comparison with their behind-the-scenes antics. Drama, starring Stephanie Beacham, Christopher Plummer, Linda Purl, Gary Collins and Ben Browder(n)

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange(n)

programme.title: For the Love of a Child
programme.desc: Two inspirational women who carry out extensive work with abused, neglected and abandoned children around the world. Drama, starring Peri Gilpin, Teri Polo and Maria Del Mar(n)

programme.title: For the Future: The Irvine Fertility Scandal
programme.desc: A childless couple undergo fertility treatment at a supposedly respectable clinic, and they are finally blessed with a baby boy. However, following the birth of their son, they begin to uncover the shocking truth behind the painful and expensive procedure. Fact-based drama, starring Marilu Henner, Randle Mell and Castulo Guerra(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A local girl is abused by her husband, and Mary Ellen and Erin end up getting involved. Meanwhile, Jim Bob schemes to make money by selling war surplus goods(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob builds a television set so that the family can see John-Boy's experimental TV project(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary mistakenly jumps to the conclusion that her mother has fallen for Chris, the handsome handyman they have hired to finish work on the house(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura and her friend Andy find a mother dog in a trap and two puppies nearby. They take the `dogs' home, only to find out they are wolves(n)

programme.title: Losing Chase
programme.desc: An intimate and turbulent relationship develops between a woman recovering from a nervous breakdown and the housemaid employed to look after her. Drama, starring Helen Mirren, Kyra Sedgwick and Beau Bridges(n)

programme.title: Love Takes Wing
programme.desc: A doctor takes up a new position in a small frontier town, where a mysterious illness is afflicting the residents. The medic takes desperate measures to stop the infection spreading, but also has to convince suspicious townsfolk that a local orphanage is not the source of the disease. Drama, starring Sarah Jones, Haylie Duff, Patrick Duffy and Cloris Leachman(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Voice of the Heart
programme.desc: Part two of two. The story of two unique and brilliant women, and the charismatic men they loved and lost, and to whom they ransomed their hearts. Lindsay Wagner, Victoria Tennant and James Brolin star(n)

programme.title: Gossip
programme.desc: After emerging from a bitter divorce battle, single mother Joanna returns to the sleepy home town she could not wait to flee as a teenager. As she sets about rekindling old friendships, Joanna finds herself falling in love with an old flame. However, the man is married, and the pair's affair threatens to rock the community. Romantic drama, starring Kelli Williams and Kristen Holden-Ried(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy investigates a hit-and-run incident when his younger brother is charged with the crime(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: To Live with Fear - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charles puts his life in danger and loses the respect of his best friend while struggling to raise money for his daughter's surgery, and Mr Edwards is less than pleased with his last piece of work(n)

programme.title: Remember
programme.desc: Part two of two. TV journalist Nicky Wells' life is shattered when her English aristocrat fiance Charles Devereaux suddenly disappears. She tries to console herself by concentrating on her work, but a romantic encounter with war photographer Cleeland Donovan forces her to revisit the circumstances of her former lover's mysterious double life. Romantic drama, based on Barbara Taylor Bradford's novel, starring Donna Mills and Stephen Collins(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Full Circle
programme.desc: A rape victim struggles to overcome the trauma of her ordeal and learn to trust men again, without succumbing to her mother's cynical outlook on life. Drama, starring Jennifer Barker, Teri Polo, Corbin Bernsen, Eric Lutes, Reed Diamond and Erika Slezak(n)

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: A washed-up alcoholic former lawyer is persuaded to return to the courtroom by an ex-lover, whose daughter is charged with murder. He agrees to take on the case, but finds himself at the centre of the media circus as the prosecution uses his drink problem to undermine his credibility. Courtroom drama, starring Brian Dennehy, Bonnie Bedelia and Fairuza Balk(n)

programme.title: Half a Dozen Babies
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the case of America's first surviving sextuplets, following their parents' battle to conceive through hi-tech fertility treatments, and efforts to cope with the demanding task of caring for such a large family. Melissa and Scott Reeves star, with Teri Garr and Kate McNeil(n)

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Corabeth finds a love letter in Ike's belongings and decides to file for divorce(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Rose's wedding is nearly cancelled when she discovers that she has a heart condition. Meanwhile, Cindy gets a job, but decides she wants to be a stay-at-home mother(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A spate of burglaries in Walnut Grove prompts Laura and Andy to become amateur detectives. The duo set out to catch the culprit in the act, but their efforts only end up making matters worse after Charles is caught in one of their traps(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A disheartened Doc Baker holds himself responsible for Farmer Novack's death and, unable to face the man's seven-months pregnant widow, leaves Walnut Grove(n)

programme.title: Blessings
programme.desc: A woman looks back over the events of her long life, recalling how she met and lost her husband, and the day she encountered a handyman who became a firm friend. Drama, starring Mary Tyler Moore, Liam Waite and Kathleen Quinlan(n)

programme.title: Love Comes Softly
programme.desc: A widow enters into a temporary marriage of convenience, a practical arrangement to help a recently bereaved father care for his young daughter. However, when the time comes for her to leave, she realises circumstances and people have changed. Romantic drama set in 19th-century America, starring Katherine Heigl, Dale Midkiff, and Skye McCole Bartusiak(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Act of Will
programme.desc: The story of three generations of women from the same family and their struggle through five eventful decades of hidden love. Audra is sent out to train as a nurse when her mother dies. Drama based closely on the author's own life story, starring Victoria Tennant and Elizabeth Hurley(n)

programme.title: Little Girl Lost
programme.desc: A couple take in a foster child, and hope to be able to adopt her. However, the authorities return her to her father, whom the girl claims has been abusing her. The devoted foster family begins a legal battle to regain custody. Fact-based drama, starring Tess Harper, Frederic Forrest and Patricia Kalember(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and Olivia help Ike get to know cousin Corabeth better(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A youngster shocks Charles Ingalls by offering to become his slave to ensure he gets a good education. Family drama, starring Michael Landon(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Everything to Gain
programme.desc: A woman sinks into a deep depression following the murder of her husband and two children, but the love of a mysterious man brings hope into the grieving widow's life. Drama, starring Sean Young, Jack Scalia and Anne Ramsey(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Vanished
programme.desc: A devoted mother's son is kidnapped, and as the FBI search widens, she is distressed to find herself suspected of involvement in the crime, along with a former lover who may not be what he seems. Drama set in the 1930s, starring Lisa Rinna, George Hamilton and Robert Hays(n)

programme.title: The Lost Valentine
programme.desc: A reporter investigates the story of an old woman whose husband disappeared without trace while serving in the Air Force during the Second World War, and who makes an annual pilgrimage to the last place she saw him. Touched by the devotion, the reporter tries to find the lost airman's final resting place. Drama, with Jennifer Love Hewitt and Betty White(n)

programme.title: Narrow Escape
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a valiant US Navy crew's desperate attempts to rescue an endangered child from post-war Korea. Starring Gerald McRaney, Richard Thomas and Jonathan Banks(n)

programme.title: Whose Child Is This? The War for Baby Jessica
programme.desc: A single mother offers her baby up for adoption, but has a sudden change of heart and is forced into a bitter legal wrangle with the child's new parents. Fact-based drama, starring Susan Dey, Michael Ontkean and Amanda Plummer(n)

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Part two of two. Drama based on Louisa May Alcott's novel about four sisters growing up together in New England during the American Civil War. Starring Meredith Baxter, Susan Dey and Eve Plumb(n)

programme.title: Love Finds a Home
programme.desc: A female doctor in a small 19th-century town looks after a friend in the last stages of pregnancy, but finds herself continually at odds with her patient's mother-in-law, who believes in homeopathic treatments. The doctor also has to contend with her daughter's first love and her own inability to conceive. Period drama sequel, based on Janette Oke's novel, starring Sarah Jones and Haylie Duff(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Voice of the Heart
programme.desc: Part one of two. The story of two unique and brilliant women, and the charismatic men they loved and lost, and to whom they ransomed their hearts. Lindsay Wagner, Victoria Tennant and James Brolin star(n)

programme.title: What Kind of Mother Are You
programme.desc: A woman finds it impossible to cope with her rebellious teenage daughter, so decides to scare her into changing her ways by leaving her to spend a night in jail. The plan goes tragically wrong when she discovers getting her child released is far from straightforward. Fact-based drama, starring Mel Harris, Nicholle Tom, Amanda Tapping and Alex Carter(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandpa gives the family cause for concern when he suffers a heart attack(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: To Live with Fear - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mary is diagnosed with a lethal disease, leaving Charles struggling to raise the cash to pay for medical treatment(n)

programme.title: Remember
programme.desc: Part one of two. TV journalist Nicky Wells' life is shattered when her English aristocrat fiancee Charles Devereaux suddenly disappears. She tries to console herself by concentrating on her work, but a romantic encounter with war photographer Cleeland Donovan forces her to revisit the circumstances of her former lover's mysterious double life. Romantic drama, based on Barbara Taylor Bradford's novel, starring Donna Mills and Stephen Collins(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Secrets
programme.desc: The cast of a glossy American TV series' steamy on-screen relationships pale in comparison with their behind-the-scenes antics. Drama, starring Stephanie Beacham, Christopher Plummer, Linda Purl, Gary Collins and Ben Browder(n)

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange(n)

programme.title: For the Love of a Child
programme.desc: Two inspirational women who carry out extensive work with abused, neglected and abandoned children around the world. Drama, starring Peri Gilpin, Teri Polo and Maria Del Mar(n)

programme.title: For the Future: The Irvine Fertility Scandal
programme.desc: A childless couple undergo fertility treatment at a supposedly respectable clinic, and they are finally blessed with a baby boy. However, following the birth of their son, they begin to uncover the shocking truth behind the painful and expensive procedure. Fact-based drama, starring Marilu Henner, Randle Mell and Castulo Guerra(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A local girl is abused by her husband, and Mary Ellen and Erin end up getting involved. Meanwhile, Jim Bob schemes to make money by selling war surplus goods(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob builds a television set so that the family can see John-Boy's experimental TV project(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary mistakenly jumps to the conclusion that her mother has fallen for Chris, the handsome handyman they have hired to finish work on the house(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura and her friend Andy find a mother dog in a trap and two puppies nearby. They take the `dogs' home, only to find out they are wolves(n)

programme.title: Losing Chase
programme.desc: An intimate and turbulent relationship develops between a woman recovering from a nervous breakdown and the housemaid employed to look after her. Drama, starring Helen Mirren, Kyra Sedgwick and Beau Bridges(n)

programme.title: Love Takes Wing
programme.desc: A doctor takes up a new position in a small frontier town, where a mysterious illness is afflicting the residents. The medic takes desperate measures to stop the infection spreading, but also has to convince suspicious townsfolk that a local orphanage is not the source of the disease. Drama, starring Sarah Jones, Haylie Duff, Patrick Duffy and Cloris Leachman(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Voice of the Heart
programme.desc: Part two of two. The story of two unique and brilliant women, and the charismatic men they loved and lost, and to whom they ransomed their hearts. Lindsay Wagner, Victoria Tennant and James Brolin star(n)

programme.title: Gossip
programme.desc: After emerging from a bitter divorce battle, single mother Joanna returns to the sleepy home town she could not wait to flee as a teenager. As she sets about rekindling old friendships, Joanna finds herself falling in love with an old flame. However, the man is married, and the pair's affair threatens to rock the community. Romantic drama, starring Kelli Williams and Kristen Holden-Ried(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy investigates a hit-and-run incident when his younger brother is charged with the crime(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: To Live with Fear - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charles puts his life in danger and loses the respect of his best friend while struggling to raise money for his daughter's surgery, and Mr Edwards is less than pleased with his last piece of work(n)

programme.title: Remember
programme.desc: Part two of two. TV journalist Nicky Wells' life is shattered when her English aristocrat fiance Charles Devereaux suddenly disappears. She tries to console herself by concentrating on her work, but a romantic encounter with war photographer Cleeland Donovan forces her to revisit the circumstances of her former lover's mysterious double life. Romantic drama, based on Barbara Taylor Bradford's novel, starring Donna Mills and Stephen Collins(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Full Circle
programme.desc: A rape victim struggles to overcome the trauma of her ordeal and learn to trust men again, without succumbing to her mother's cynical outlook on life. Drama, starring Jennifer Barker, Teri Polo, Corbin Bernsen, Eric Lutes, Reed Diamond and Erika Slezak(n)

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: A washed-up alcoholic former lawyer is persuaded to return to the courtroom by an ex-lover, whose daughter is charged with murder. He agrees to take on the case, but finds himself at the centre of the media circus as the prosecution uses his drink problem to undermine his credibility. Courtroom drama, starring Brian Dennehy, Bonnie Bedelia and Fairuza Balk(n)

programme.title: Half a Dozen Babies
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the case of America's first surviving sextuplets, following their parents' battle to conceive through hi-tech fertility treatments, and efforts to cope with the demanding task of caring for such a large family. Melissa and Scott Reeves star, with Teri Garr and Kate McNeil(n)

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Corabeth finds a love letter in Ike's belongings and decides to file for divorce(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Rose's wedding is nearly cancelled when she discovers that she has a heart condition. Meanwhile, Cindy gets a job, but decides she wants to be a stay-at-home mother(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A spate of burglaries in Walnut Grove prompts Laura and Andy to become amateur detectives. The duo set out to catch the culprit in the act, but their efforts only end up making matters worse after Charles is caught in one of their traps(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A disheartened Doc Baker holds himself responsible for Farmer Novack's death and, unable to face the man's seven-months pregnant widow, leaves Walnut Grove(n)

programme.title: Blessings
programme.desc: A woman looks back over the events of her long life, recalling how she met and lost her husband, and the day she encountered a handyman who became a firm friend. Drama, starring Mary Tyler Moore, Liam Waite and Kathleen Quinlan(n)

programme.title: Love Comes Softly
programme.desc: A widow enters into a temporary marriage of convenience, a practical arrangement to help a recently bereaved father care for his young daughter. However, when the time comes for her to leave, she realises circumstances and people have changed. Romantic drama set in 19th-century America, starring Katherine Heigl, Dale Midkiff, and Skye McCole Bartusiak(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Act of Will
programme.desc: The story of three generations of women from the same family and their struggle through five eventful decades of hidden love. Audra is sent out to train as a nurse when her mother dies. Drama based closely on the author's own life story, starring Victoria Tennant and Elizabeth Hurley(n)

programme.title: Little Girl Lost
programme.desc: A couple take in a foster child, and hope to be able to adopt her. However, the authorities return her to her father, whom the girl claims has been abusing her. The devoted foster family begins a legal battle to regain custody. Fact-based drama, starring Tess Harper, Frederic Forrest and Patricia Kalember(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John and Olivia help Ike get to know cousin Corabeth better(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A youngster shocks Charles Ingalls by offering to become his slave to ensure he gets a good education. Family drama, starring Michael Landon(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Everything to Gain
programme.desc: A woman sinks into a deep depression following the murder of her husband and two children, but the love of a mysterious man brings hope into the grieving widow's life. Drama, starring Sean Young, Jack Scalia and Anne Ramsey(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Vanished
programme.desc: A devoted mother's son is kidnapped, and as the FBI search widens, she is distressed to find herself suspected of involvement in the crime, along with a former lover who may not be what he seems. Drama set in the 1930s, starring Lisa Rinna, George Hamilton and Robert Hays(n)

programme.title: The Lost Valentine
programme.desc: A reporter investigates the story of an old woman whose husband disappeared without trace while serving in the Air Force during the Second World War, and who makes an annual pilgrimage to the last place she saw him. Touched by the devotion, the reporter tries to find the lost airman's final resting place. Drama, with Jennifer Love Hewitt and Betty White(n)

programme.title: Narrow Escape
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a valiant US Navy crew's desperate attempts to rescue an endangered child from post-war Korea. Starring Gerald McRaney, Richard Thomas and Jonathan Banks(n)

programme.title: Victory Lap
programme.desc: Axe assembles a war room in the Hamptons following a disastrous setback in Sandicot for Axe Capital. The fate of the town hangs in the balance while Axe seeks counsel on how best to recoup his losses. Chuck capitalizes on a high profile victory, but alienates Wendy in the process, causing the couple to change the status of their separation(n)

programme.title: Inside the Greatest Political Show on Earth: 203
programme.desc: What do people outside the Beltway really think about President Trump? Mark Halperin takes a trip through America to find the answers. Then he heads to New Orleans to discuss his surprising findings with Mary Matalin(n)
Carrie & Quinn make a discovery. Keane makes a decision. Max finds trouble(n)

programme.title: American Jihad
programme.desc: Documentary probe into the phenomenon of home-grown Jihadism, analyzing the strategic outreach and tactics employed by terrorists in order to reach susceptible members of society and what can be done to prevent it. Featuring intimate stories from former Jihadists radicalized to commit violent acts of terrorism and their families and communities caught in the crosshairs(n)

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: Directed by the iconic Tim Burton, this tale is based on the outrageous true story of one of the most epic art frauds in history, which stars Amy Adams as an artist who creates enigmatic paintings of waifs with big eyes, which are appropriated by her husband as his own work, catapulting him to unearned fame(n)

programme.title: Poltergeist III
programme.desc: Carole Anne is sent to live in a Chicago high-rise with her Uncle Bruce and his new wife, Pat. But that doesn't mean that she's escaped the apparitions that have haunted her in the past(n)

programme.title: Premonition (2007)
programme.desc: The world of a suburban wife and mother (Sandra Bullock) is shattered when her husband is killed in a car accident. But reality soon begins warping, bouncing her through time before and after his death - and giving her a chance to change her family's fate. Julian McMahon, Nia Long, Kate Nelligan, Peter Stormare and Amber Valletta costar in this mind-bending thriller(n)

programme.title: The Ex
programme.desc: After his baby son is born, chronic underachiever Tom Reilly (Zach Braff) is suddenly forced to grow up and take a job working in his father-in-law's advertising agency after his wife Sofia (Amanda Peet) elects to leave her career as a lawyer. One little wrinkle: Sofia's seemingly perfect, wheelchair-bound ex-boyfriend (Jason Bateman) also works for the same company, and immediately sets about undermining Tom at every turn. Charles Grodin, Mia Farrow and Donal Logue costar in this comedy cult favorite(n)

programme.title: Killing Season
programme.desc: Robert DeNiro and John Travolta star as two veterans of the Bosnian War -- one American, one Serbian -- who find their unlikely friendship tested when one of them reveals their true intentions(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo
programme.desc: Rob Schneider stars as an average aquarium cleaner who house-sits for a gigolo - only to be forced to become one himself(n)

programme.title: America's Sweethearts
programme.desc: For an awkward, self-conscious girl like Kiki (Julia Roberts), being the personal assistant to a beautiful megastar like Gwen (Catherine Zeta-Jones) is no bowl of cherries. But when she reluctantly accepts the task of helping Gwen and her estranged husband (John Cusack) make it through one last public appearance - masterminded by legendary press agent Lee Phillips (Billy Crystal) - Kiki finds her job satisfaction plummeting(n)

programme.title: Mother's Day
programme.desc: Legendary filmmaker Garry Marshall directs an all-star cast including Jennifer Aniston, Kate Hudson, Julia Roberts and Jason Sudeikis in this romantic comedy about a group of strong, loving and wildly imperfect women who are about to prove the power of the maternal bond(n)
